summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, providing a confidential, verbatim English translation of information received from the French Ministry of Justice. The translation describes an alleged victim's account of meeting Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in France, traveling with them, and being sexually assaulted by Epstein in New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as a defendant in the case (20 Cr. 330) and described as Jeffrey Epstein's partner. The translated excerpt states she invited the alleged victim to New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as Ghislaine Maxwell's partner. The translated excerpt alleges he sexually assaulted the victim in New York.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Mentioned in the translated excerpt; the alleged victim stated she had never met him.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the letter as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as partners who met the alleged victim together in France and with whom she traveled.
The alleged victim traveled from France to Miami with the couple.
Presented together as a couple who made friends with the alleged victim.

events.title: Alleged Victim Meets Epstein and Maxwell
events.description: An alleged victim, then 16, met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in the south of France and later visited their Paris apartment on Avenue Foch.

events.title: Travel to Miami
events.description: The alleged victim left for Miami with Epstein and Maxwell six months after meeting them.

events.title: Alleged Sexual Assault in New York
events.description: The alleged victim was invited to New York by Ghislaine Maxwell. During a 5-day stay, Jeffrey Epstein touched her sexually despite her resistance.

locations: Parisian apartment on Avenue Foch, Paris
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office received and translated information from the French Ministry of Justice regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
A translated excerpt describes an alleged victim who met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell in France at age 16 in 2000.
The alleged victim traveled with the couple to Miami and was later invited to New York by Ghislaine Maxwell, where she was sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein.
The alleged victim stated she had never met Jean-Luc Brunel, another associate in the case.
The document is designated as 'confidential' under the Protective Order governing the case.
